alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 2:19PM CDT until September 01 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Henry and Houston. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Headland, Dothan, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Avon, Pearce, Barber, Pleasant Plains, Enon, Sigma, Smyrna, Grandberry Crossroads, Headland Municipal A/P, Ardilla and Farley Nuclear Plant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
